title: Tex-Mex Chicken Casserole
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) bag nacho cheese-flavored corn chips (such as Doritos), crushed into crumbs
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.5 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
method: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Spread corn chip crumbs over bottom of the baking dish; press crumbs into place.
Step 3: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, 6 to 7 minutes.

Step 4: Combine diced tomatoes, cream of chicken soup. cream of mushroom soup, green chiles, milk, sour cream, chili powder, and cumin in a large bowl. Stir in chicken and onion to combine; pour over corn chips. Top with Cheddar cheese.
Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and cheese is melted, 55 to 60 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
Step 6: Feel free to use Cool Ranch Doritos in place of Nacho Cheese Doritos and Rotel tomatoes in place of canned diced tomatoes and canned green chiles.
